729468f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729468f-b.text:
(1)
386 and 396 Richmond Terrace, soth side,
between Westervelt Avenue and St. Peters Place.
No. 386 (left) appears in Bromley's 19217 map
as the iest Day and Evening School. From 1874
to 1907 it belonged to the Hendleton family.
No. 396 belonged to the ilkinson family accord-
ing to the real estate maps of 1874 to 1907.
May 2, 1928
P. i. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the two houses, showing, more
prominently, No. 396-the Vilkinson house. The view
is eastward, the opposite direction from view 1.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729468f-b.folder: Richmond Terrace & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729469f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729469f-a.text:
404 Richmond Terrace, adjoing the S. E.corner of
Westervelt aVenue, shnowing the Richmond Knights of Columbus
olubhouse. In 1907 it belonged to Geo. J. Greenfield, and from
1A.74 to 1828 to the Wilkinson family. The house is mmodeled in
the Doric oruer of Greek architecture. Across tho roof of the
house appears the steeple of St. Peters R. C. Cnurch.

729470f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729470f-a.text:
414 Richmond Terrace, at the S.E. corner of Westervelt
Avenue. The mansion was on the Brooks estate in 1874; from
1898 to 1907 it belongeo to Jas. Crabtree.
May 2, 1928
